meanings.definition: A person or thing that smashes.
meanings.sent1: The little boy was known as the smasher because he loved breaking things.
meanings.sent2: The wrecking ball was a powerful smasher, demolishing the old building in minutes.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy giant was a smasher in the china shop, causing chaos wherever he went.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a smasher, filling the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The storm was a relentless smasher, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: A very successful or popular person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The singer became a smasher overnight with her hit song.
meanings.sent2: The new movie was a box office smasher, breaking records left and right.
meanings.sent3: The little bakery on the corner was a smasher, drawing in crowds with its delicious pastries.
meanings.sent4: His invention was a smasher, revolutionizing the way people lived.
meanings.sent5: The team captain was a true smasher, leading the team to victory after victory.

meanings.sent1: The boxer delivered a smasher to his opponent, knocking him out cold.
meanings.sent2: The hammer came down with a loud smasher, driving the nail deep into the wood.
meanings.sent3: The baseball player hit a smasher, sending the ball flying out of the park.
meanings.sent4: The thunderclap was a smasher, shaking the windows with its force.
meanings.sent5: The car crash was a devastating smasher, leaving the vehicles mangled and twisted.
